data.title: Trusted Boise Eye Doctor
data.meta_description: Get professional eye care at The Eye Pros in Boise. Our experienced eye doctors offer quality vision services. Schedule your visit now!
data.text:
Experience top-tier eye care at The Eye Pros in Boise, Idaho! Nestled in the picturesque Treasure Valley, Boise stands as the dynamic heart of Idaho, offering the perfect backdrop for our commitment to your vision health. Our eye doctor in Boise is dedicated to providing comprehensive, personalized care to ensure you see your best.

Our skilled team at The Eye Pros understands the importance of clear vision in enjoying the vibrant activities Boise has to offer. Our eye doctor in Boise will ensure you see your best, allowing you to fully experience the city’s adventures.

At our Boise office, you’ll be greeted by our friendly staff, dedicated to making your visit smooth and comfortable. We pride ourselves on providing quick yet thorough eye exams. Our Boise vision care ensures you see a doctor promptly and can get your glasses within an hour! Plus, we offer the convenience of same day glasses for those who need them quickly.

We continuously seek to improve our services and stay at the forefront of vision advancements. At The Eye Pros in Boise, we utilize the latest cutting-edge technology for vision testing and treatment, ensuring you receive a top-tier exam. Our commitment is to enhance your quality of life through exceptional Boise vision care.

Visit our Boise location and trust us to be your partner in preserving and enhancing your precious sight, allowing you to fully embrace all that this beautiful city has to offer.

Dr. Lavar Kofoed has been practicing Optometry since 1996 and has set up offices in Utah and Idaho. He is the CEO of LWK PC, the parent company of The Eye Pros. He graduated from Fruitland High 1985. In 1992 he received a BS Degree from Brigham Young University and then a Doctorate from Pacific University College of Optometry in 1996. He is a member of the Idaho Optometric Physicians (IOP), Utah Optometric Physicians Association and the American Optometric Associations (AOA). He works with local ophthalmologists in co-managing surgical procedures including LASIK, PRK, and cataract surgery. He regularly consults and is an advisor to national optometric groups.

Dr. Kofoed loves America and the freedom he enjoys as a patriotic citizen. He is married with 11 children and an ever growing number of grandchildren. He spends most of his spare time with his family, who sings and performs on a regular basis. Kofoedfamilymusic.com.

Dr. Erik Thompson is one of the co-owners of The Eye Pros in Boise, Meridian and Nampa. He started practicing with Dr Kofoed in 2012. Dr Thompson is the Chief Medical Officer over all Eye Pros locations in Utah and Idaho.

Dr Thompson is certified in treating ocular diseases such as cataracts, glaucoma, and macular degeneration. He co-manages LASIK and cataract surgery. He is certified in fitting soft, hard, and scleral contacts. Dr Thompson received his Bachelor’s of Science in Biology and Specialized Mechanical Engineering degrees from BYU Idaho and his Doctor of Optometry Degree from Indiana University in 2011. Dr. Thompson completed several internships in Indianapolis Indiana, Louisville Kentucky, and the Eye institute of Utah in Salt Lake City.

Outside of work Dr. Thompson loves spending time with his wife and 5 children. He likes watching and playing sports, being outdoors, and serving in his church.

Dr. Chris Robison grew up in Rigby, Idaho. He received his Bachelor of Science degree in Biology with an emphasis on Human Biology from Brigham Young University Idaho while also studying music as a guitarist and singer as well as teaching a guitar & ukulele workshop. Dr. Robison began his optometric education at the prestigious Pacific University College of Optometry in Oregon. While at Pacific University, he acquired additional training in pediatric optometry, vision therapy, specialty contact lenses, & ocular disease.

As part of his clinical education, Dr. Robison trained at the Hollingshead Eye Center in Boise, Idaho. This training concentrated on ocular disease, such as glaucoma, macular degeneration, cataracts, pre and post surgical care, corneal pathology, and retinal vascular disease.

He later trained at Hill Air Force Base in Ogden, Utah, where he served members of the United States Air Force, providing them with excellent glasses and contact lens solutions, frequently helping them get better than 20/20 vision. Dr. Robison also trained at the prestigious Eye Institute of Utah, in Salt Lake City, Utah, which emphasized advanced dry eye treatment, a large variety of retinal pathology, & neurological conditions. He then received additional training on diabetic retinopathy, and inflammatory eye disease at the Indian Health Services in Fort Hall, Idaho. Dr. Robison has a whole body approach to eye care and loves to find the underlying causes of eye disease so he can best help his patients.

In his free time, Dr. Robison enjoys being active, hiking, camping, & anything outdoors, as well as going to movies, cooking, singing & playing guitar.

Dr. Christine Chong grew up in Washington state. She graduated from Pacific Lutheran University in Tacoma with a bachelors of science in biology. Dr Chong then attended graduate school at Pacific University, where she graduated with honors and received her doctorate in optometry. After graduation, Dr Chong practiced optometry in Las Vegas, NV and the Tri Cities, WA. During this time, Dr Chong gained experience in pediatric and primary care optometry and served a diverse mix of patients. Dr Chong is a member of the American Optometric Association (AOA) and the Idaho Optometric Physicians (IOP).

In her free time, Dr Chong enjoys making things and going on adventures with her husband and their greyhounds.

Dr Brian Rast grew up all over Idaho and eventually ended up in Eagle where he graduated from Meridian HS. He then attended Rick’s College in Rexburg, ID, and then finished his undergraduate degree at the University of Texas- Dallas in Dallas, TX. From 1990-1994 he attended Pacific University’s College of Optometry in Oregon where he earned his Dr of Optometry degree. Dr Rast spent the better part of the last 30 years practicing in the DFW area of Texas. Areas of interest include contact lenses, sports vision, and co-management of cataract and LASIK surgeries.

Outside of the office Dr Rast loves sports, outdoor activities, and spending as much time as possible with family. He is excited to be living back in the mountains of Idaho and taking care of eye care needs here.

Dr. Lance Bloom is a native of Colorado. He graduated with a Bachelor’s of Science from BYU–Idaho in 2009, then completed his Doctor of Optometry at Midwestern University–Arizona College of Optometry in 2013. While in school he completed various internships in pediatric optometry/vision therapy, primary eye care, and ocular disease. Dr. Bloom has practiced in multiple practice settings, including managing his own practice in Colorado prior to moving with his family to Idaho.

Dr. Bloom enjoys working with patients of all ages, but he especially enjoys working with children and youth, and has performed thousands of pediatric vision exams. He also speaks Spanish and loves working with the hispanic community. He will gladly perform your exam in Spanish if you desire. Dr. Bloom strongly believes in patient education and listening to his patients in order to ensure that each patient’s functional visual needs are met during the eye exam.

In his personal time he enjoys spending time with his wife and their four children, singing, playing guitar, and following his sports teams. He’s especially happy that he could move to Boise and still be a Broncos fan.
